item.title: Max add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Only people who are capable of loving strongly can also suffer great sorrow, but this same necessity of loving serves to counteract their grief and heals them." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Max add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "If everyone fought for their own convictions there would be no war." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Max add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "True life is lived when tiny changes occur." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Max add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Happiness does not depend on outward things, but on the way we see them." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Max add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Everyone thinks of changing the world, but no one thinks of changing himself." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Max add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "a generation that cannot endure boredom will be a generation of little men, of men unduly divorced from the slow process of nature, of men in whom every vital impulse slowly withers as though they were cut flowers in a vase." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Max add a quote by Robert M. Pirsig
item.description: "Peace of mind produces right values, right values produce right thoughts. Right thoughts produce right actions and right actions produce work which will be a material reflection for others to see of the serenity at the center of it all." -- Robert M. Pirsig
